text: Bidens cabopulmensis is a rare species of flowering plant in the daisy family. It is known only from the region in and near Cabo Pulmo National Park called Punta Arena. This is in the State of Baja California Sur in western Mexico.The International Plant Names Index Bidens cabopulmensis is a perennial herb up to 40 cm (16 inches) tall, generally branching only near the base. It produces one yellow flower heads per branch, each head containing both disc florets and ray florets. The species grows on coastal sand dunes.José Luis León de la Luz & Alfonso Medel–Narváez. 2013. Acta botánica mexicana 103: 120. description, commentary in English; short diagnosis in Latin, abstracts in English + Spanish, photos in color ==References== ==External links== cabopulmensis Category:Flora of Baja California Sur Category:Plants described in 2013 Category:Dunes of Mexico
title: Bidens cabopulmensis
